alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan; Cedar; Clinton; Delaware; Dubuque; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 10:46AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Jackson, Buchanan, Cedar, northwestern Scott, southwestern Dubuque, northeastern Johnson, northeastern Benton, Jones, Delaware, northwestern Muscatine, Linn and northwestern Clinton Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1045 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jesup to 6 miles east of Solon. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Iowa City, Independence, Anamosa, Vinton, Manchester, Tipton, West Branch, Mechanicsville, Stanwood, Marion, Coralville, North Liberty, Hiawatha, Mount Vernon, Monticello, Robins, Jesup, Center Point and Cascade. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 238 and 262. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Buchanan; Cedar; Clinton; Delaware; Dubuque; Jackson; Johnson; Jones; Linn; Muscatine; Scott
